projects.description: This project shows quotes from famous musicians by making a random selection from an array of objects. Aside from the user clicking the button, the app automatically changes the background color and displayed quote every 10 seconds.

This project works with a long list of student info cards and puts them on separate pages using JavaScript. This simple but useful pagination program can work with short or long lists of data, adjusting the pagination numbers as needed.

This project is a signup page for a fictional tech conference. The page validates a form submission to help prepare data to be more usable, aka "data scrubbing." It features validation for textfields, checkboxes, dropdown lists, etc. The page won't submit unless multiple criteria are met.

This is a word guessing game that displays a win or lose message at the end. A right guess shows the letter on the game board, while a wrong guess subtracts a life point. If you guess the phrase without running out of lives, you win!

This project involves working with an API connection and fetching web data with asynchronous JavaScript. The project itself, enables the user to search through a list of employees and click on an employee's card to view more information. Next and previous buttons add functionality from a modal window, so the user can conveniently veiw each of the employee cards containing more detailed information.
